poem:
"Contemptuous Verse for the Unyielding"

Navarro courts the gavel's thud—
Two counts of pride, contemptuous flood.
Once advisor on Trump's wing,
Now faces censure's bitter sting.

Subpoena scorned, House questions dodged,
Now the iron bars are lodged. 
In the shadows of Capitol's day,
The price of hubris one must pay.

"Beware," the echo softly droned,
"Those who defy will stand alone."
